body:
<!-- This issue tracker is only for technical issues related to Bitcoin Core.

<!-- Describe the issue --> Bitcoin Core 0.18.0 requests access to Contacts.app and Calendar.app on macOS Mojave from a new installation on a formatted machine.

<!--- What behavior did you expect? --> I am certain I've never seen this happen before.

<!--- What was the actual behavior (provide screenshots if the issue is GUI-related)? -->

![Screen Shot 2019 07 16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52983118/61341016-1caa0a80-a81b-11e9-8f22-6757e0b4cbe2.png)
![Screen Shot 2019-07-16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52983118/61341017-1caa0a80-a81b-11e9-9a26-6ba50973aab4.png)

<!--- How reliably can you reproduce the issue, what are the steps to do so? --> Format macOS, install Mojave, install Bitcoin Core 0.18.0

<!-- What version of Bitcoin Core are you using, where did you get it (website, self-compiled, etc)? --> Bitcoin Core 0.18.0 from https://bitcoincore.org/en/download/ **verified** with SHA256.

<!-- What type of machine are you observing the error on (OS/CPU and disk type)? --> macOS Mojave on MacBook Air.

<!-- For the GUI-related issue on Linux provide names and versions of a distro, a desktop environment and a graphical shell (if relevant). -->

<!-- Any extra information that might be useful in the debugging process. -->

<!--- This is normally the contents of a `debug.log` or `config.log` file. Raw text or a link to a pastebin type site are preferred. -->
title: Bitcoin Core 0.18.0 requests access to Contacts.app and Calendar.app on macOS Mojave from a new installation on a formatted machine.
